result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • David Peter Hoiland was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.

Defendant David Peter Hoiland in court with attorney Robert C Howard.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily, rights given.  Court binds Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to defendant, reading waived.

Defendant David Peter Hoiland in court with attorney Robert C Howard.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads Guilty freely and voluntarily to Count 1; Count 2 Dismissed and Read In; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; PSI WAIVED; Court orders: 2 years WSPrison, 3 years Extended Sueprvision; $1744 fine DOC Collect; DL Revoked 36 months, Ignition Interlock 36 months, Assessment, Restitution DOC Collect, Bond to apply to Restitution Only; Deft IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program, Deft IS NOT Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, 3 days credit. 15TR4266 and 15TR4267 Reopen and Dismiss both citations.
